metadata.Title: CVE-2019-8675 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A buffer overflow issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in macOS Mojave 10.14.6, Security Update 2019-004 High Sierra, Security Update 2019-004 Sierra. An attacker in a privileged network position may be able to execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-8675` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cups - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7
cups-bsd - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7
cups-client - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7
cups-common - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7
cups-core-drivers - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7
cups-daemon - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7
cups-ipp-utils - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7
cups-ppdc - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7
cups-server-common - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7
libcups2 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7
libcupscgi1 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7
libcupsimage2 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7
libcupsmime1 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7
libcupsppdc1 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Stephan Zeisberg of Security Research Labs (srlabs.de)

criterions.comment: cups package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7').
